qas.question: Where does Catalan get a lot of its learned words?
When did the process of acquiring words from Latin and Greek begin?
In whose work can you find examples of acquired words?
When did Catalan have a greater number of Greco-Latin words than other Romance languages?
Whose writings are a good example of learned words in Catalan?

context: Like other languages, Catalan has a large list of learned words from <a0_0>Greek and Latin<a0_0/>. This process started <a1_0>very early<a1_0/>, and one can find such examples in <a2_0>Ramon Llull<a2_0/>'s work. On the <a3_0>fourteenth and fifteenth centuries<a3_0/> Catalan had a number of Greco-Latin learned words much superior to other Romance languages, as it can be attested for example in <a4_0>Roís de Corella<a4_0/>'s writings.
